System.Title: Ability to adjust project duration based on customer requirements (bulk update)
System.Description: >Main objective creating the first project as forecasting timelines 1 year ahead of SU was to visualize the forecasting for next year. During initial forecast, TEL does not know what the factory can or cannot finish during production (just an estimate) and do not know the customer\u2019s specific schedule at this point. Later when the schedule is more defined there needs to be a way to easily modify all of the project tasks that saves time.

>Ability to quickly change multiple project tasks including the WBS.  There could be 100's of tasks and need a fast and efficient way for the end user to make changes to the schedule, without having to modify each one at a time.

>There were several potential solutions discussed in the meetings, such as changing the project template of the existing project and batch processing.  PSA does not support batch processing and cannot swap out the project template after a project has been created.
>1. Utilizing PowerApps could be done to add multiple resources at one of editing multiple tasks, but this would be a very customized solution and would require a large amount of development.
>2. Create a new project from a project template and copy over the SAP information into the new project.  Deactivate the old project.
>1. Ability for the user to update more than one WBS tasks at a time.
>   (Especially BULK ASSIGN generic resource to support shift assignment)
>All projects will be generated from a project template that will have the generic resources already associated to the template.  Multiple updates will happen to the WBS when:
>New tasks are added to the project and might or not require a new project template.
>Additional resources need to be added to project tasks to speed up delivery or add
>2. Date changes that are made during bulk edit should be reflected in tasks that have dependencies on the updated items.
>Any project tasks that have dependencies will automatically be changed when the predecessor project task date changes (Out-of-the-box).
>3. Template change need to be supported with high usability.
>Changing from 1 shift to multiple shifts.  This is a manual process.
>Trigger Events (What event makes this happen)
>Preconditions (What is needed before this can happen)
>Post Conditions (What happens after the event happens/what is everything affected by change)
Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria: 1. Ability for the user to update more than one WBS tasks at a time.

>   (Especially BULK ASSIGN generic resource to support shift assignment)

2. Date changes that are made during bulk edit should be reflected in tasks that have dependencies on the updated items.

>3. Template change need to be supported with high usability.
  This should be done in phase 3.  We need to look at the impact of SAP integration and Opportunity to Project workflows.
Microsoft.Services.Custom.ArchComments:
>Schedule board should answer this need and user should open two windows 1. Schedule board 2. Project Template/ Project details to adjust the timelines and resources.

<TBD> with

System.Title: (Opp Integration) Apply template automatically to create project (before SAP integration)
System.Description: >Ability to create the initial project and WBS with customer template before we implement the SAP integration.
>The sales opportunity should provide the model, region, and customer.  If an
> is set to "Type C" then the system will use the model, region, and customer attributes from the
> to select the associated draft template and generate the PSA project and work order.
>Some of the project templates may only be matched by Model.
>TEL will create the default template for each product.
>   Each region may have different standard working hours.  Example U.S.A. is 8 am to 5 pm.
>Will confirm the amount of configuration and customization and provide to TEL.  Japan will provide all of the templates needed.
>Trigger Events (What event makes this happen)
>Preconditions (What is needed before this can happen)
>Template must be available for the model and customer.
>Post Conditions (What happens after the event happens/what is everything affected by change)
>The PSA project and WBS would be created
Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria: >1.Be able to create Project when new Sales opportunity is created.
> (For intel use Sales opportunity data / For others use NIS FCST data exist in Sales CRM)
>2.Be able to set default template based on the Model and Customer information.
>(This requirement will be set with Requirement
> for the template change function with Create New with copy all tribute data)
>3. Be able to update Project attribute data based on Opportunity data update.
>(For intel forecast some times customer, tool ID will change thus need to ability to update the information is required)

System.Title: Ability to plan project WBS and tasks by the shift time selected ( 24 hrs / 3 shifts etc)
Custom.ReqReason: Code Complete and System Test Passed
System.Description: >PSA needs the ability to support different shift work on different project task & work order items within the same project.  <span style=\
>Project shifts will need to be designed as it will span across resource shifts and shift rules.  WBS will need to have a place to record the number of shifts. <span style=\
> Shifts are set to either 1, 2, or 3 per day.  A resource could be used hookup task running 3 shifts and later in a startup task running in 1 shift.
>Adding number of shifts should not effect the effort but will change the duration.

>TEL separates plan into three different sections (Hookup, Startup, and Process).  Hookup sub-tasks might be worked 12 hour shifts by 3 resources where the Startup sub-tasks might by 1 or 2 people on 8 hour shifts.

>MS needs to present the best way to support multiple shifts for resources in their calendars, especially in regard to viewing resources for multiple shifts in the schedule board and not showing the resource as being able to work 24 hours in the day.
>TEL has presented their solution below for Microsoft to review.  The slide below touches on the following points.

>For the calendar TEL would like to set how many hours each shift works on specific date (Mon through Friday).  TEL would not assign AM or PM, just the duration (total amount of hours).  Want to avoid system thinking a resource can work 24 hours when the project calls for 3 shifts.
>Trigger Events (What event makes this happen)

>Changing shifts and resources should recalculate the duration for the task.

Preconditions (What is needed before this can happen)
Have to correct calculations in the  duration.

Post Conditions (What happens after the event happens/what is everything affected by change)

>Ability to set the number of shifts for a sub-task.

Flow (Where and when does this happen in the process)
>1: Shifts are imported in from the file.
>2. User will update the shifts in the WBS of the project.

>
Field Validation
The shift field should validate that the shift is a numeric value and no greater than 3.

Note
TEL update title "WO" to "WBS"
>The "Working with Calendar Template and Shifts" document attached confirms the approach outlined in the "
Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. Can enter the time to represent a shift for each process.

2. System should support 1st shift (Normal shift), as well as 2nd, and 3rd shift representation for each process.
>3. Need to be able to
> support All project base shift change (Calendar change)
>(Ex. All prefacility set up to process work to be supported with 2 shifts with 10hours a day)
>4. Need to be able to support specific Process based shift change. (Manual mode WBS task edit)
>(Ex. Only hardware setup to perform 2 shifts with 10hours a day work, other process will work 8 hours a day)
Microsoft.Services.Custom.ArchComments: Based on the discussion with Maeda san it's understood that shifts are manually managed with proper calendar setup.

>It is recommended that any project management not be done on the mobile device and only in the web interface.  The predecessor tasks will not update if the project task start and end dates are changed in the mobile application.

System.Title: Ability to track non-conformance hours happen on the field (original : Ability to track non-conformance parts)
Custom.ReqReason: Code Complete and System Test Passed
System.Description: >Daily Hours Sync back to PSA #204\n
>Usability of tracking hours at sub-task level #240
>is anything outside of the standard operation
>both Trouble happen during the start up activity & Factory remaining work and those hours need to be tracked separated from planned hours.

>Troubleshooting is a good example of this. When equipment comes in with the tools, the engineer starts and goes through the necessary parts.  Any exceptions or additional work will need to be tracked.
>This needs to be noted and tracked, so later if manager asks why it took longer than planned the engineer would have the history of the non-conformance work.
>This will also be used to c
>apture which tasks also cause trouble in order to change the procedure to understand hours for this risk in the future.
>We need to track the hours in the project task of the non-conformance piece, but the hours of the non-conformance piece should not be added to the project task progress.

>Please see flow in the file attachments.  The new fields for the MVP requirements will be stored in one spreadsheet on Teams.  Please review  at TEL Phase 2 -> General -> Files -> Requirements ->"Entity Fields Vxx"
>To work around this we can change Actual Hours\nfield label to Total Hours on the Project Task (Sub task).
>We would\nthen create a new custom custom field to roll-up the non-conformance hours on the Project Task
>The none conformnace hours should be roll-up using new creation filed on current WO "Task2" entity to define which task should count as "Planned work actual  hours" , "<font color=\
> For example for TEA task2 "Factory reming task","Troubleshooting", "None Standard Set up" should be treated as None coformnace hours
>Task name : Factory remaining part install (Factory remain task)
>User input as time entry : None conformance  task : 9h  / Troubleshooting : 5h
>User input as time entry : Hock-up : 9h  / Troubleshooting : 5h
>Trigger Events (What event makes this happen)
>A non-conformance instance with the work order.<br style=\
>Preconditions (What is needed before this can happen)
>Post Conditions (What happens after the event happens/what is everything affected by change)

>Please see flow in the file attachments.  The new fields for the MVP requirements will be stored in one spreadsheet on Teams.  Please review  at TEL Phase 2 -> General -> Files -> Requirements ->"Entity Fields Vxx"
Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria: <div>1. System will display a roll-up of the <span style=\

>Factory remaining task hours & Trouble hours hours at the task level.
2. Non-conformance hours will be hours worked that are identified as non-conformance

> WO Time entry which is defined as none conformance task in TASK2 entity
3. User cannot manually update the non-conformance hours (roll-up) field
> Progress % only reflect planned wrench time (Factory remaining task should be treated as planned hours)  <a href=\
Microsoft.Services.Custom.ArchComments: <div>Please refer to the solution approach present in <a href=\

System.Title: Ability to define process flow from forecasting to project execution
Custom.ReqReason: Code Complete and System Test Passed
System.Description: >Need the ability to graphically display the current stage that we are at directly on the Project.

> Will have two business flow templates \nOne with Pre-facility set-up and one without.  Some projects will not have Pre-facility Set-up.  For the ones that do not have Pre-facility\nset-up, then that stage should not be included on that business flow template.

The new milestones listed below are mapped to the BPF processes in the "

>Milestone Process Mapping" attachment. 
  • Exit Factory Date
  • FOB/FCA Date
  • Pre Facility Start Date
  • On Doc Date (ODD)
  • Machine Move In
  • Start Up (Hook-Up) Start Date
  • SL1 Completion Date
  • Start Up (Hardware) End Date
  • SL2 Completion Date
  • Start Up (Hardware) End Date
  • Process Qualification Start Date
  • Process Qualification End Date
  • Transfer to Genpo
  • Machine Hand Off
  • Local System Acceptance Date

See Attachments
Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. Ability to check the current stage of the process.

2. System should automatically move from one stage to another stage in the process when certain criteria is meet.

3. User should be able to manually move from one stage to another, when criteria cannot be used for automation.

System.Title: Ability to select tasks for time entry on mobile app
Custom.ReqReason: Code Complete and System Test Passed
System.Description:
>One work order for a project task and 6 bookings for 6 resources for the sub tasks
In the mobile app, when a technician books time, show the technician an option to select what sub tasks were covered for that time duration.
>Same functionality will also need to be available in the web application.

>If a field service has 6 project and 6 sub-tasks in the work order.  The field service user would have to go to 6 work orders bookings to track the tasks.  Any other quick way for field service to track the hours to these tasks and not sub-tasks.  Maybe select service tasks to quickly capture the hours.  Field service would find it difficult to have to change back in forth to track hours.  Current process is field service to track hours at the work order.  Requirement would be to get the hours at the sub-task level.

>Possible associate time to work order service tasks.  POC project subtasks tracking hours is confusing, 2nd is booking hours on service task, 3rd time entry is created then they can select the service tasks for this time.   This will have dependency on work order project.
>Preconditions (What is needed\nbefore this can happen)
>Post Conditions (What happens\nafter the event happens/what is everything affected by change)
Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria: <div>1. User should be able to enter hours on mobile device <span style=\
>(Time stamp should be created by only changing service task selection since user will continue to work for wrench time but task they do will change ex. "move in" to "Piping connection")

>2. When selecting the service task on booking for real time time stamp input, user should not see the closed service tasks. (by using change view user will be able to select closed service task for after work input case) 

3. User can enter in hours for multiple processes on the mobile device for the same work order without having to start and stop the booking status each time.
>*Does this mean one WO will have only One Booking per resource?
>\u200b (Adam had reply and it was ckarified : Shohei Maeda)

System.Title: Ability to assign subcontractor resources
Custom.ReqReason: Code Complete and System Test Passed
System.Description: >Japan and Korea cannot name subcontractor.
>When using subcontractor for Japan and Korea, TEL cannot specify which resource they want to use. The subcontractor company owns the setting up resource\u2019s assignment.

><span>The subcontractors will give license to the contractor\u2019s supervisor of the company.  The supervisor will assign all the resources for the the process/shift that are assigned to the subcontractor.  Email notification is covered in requirement <span><a href=\

>
TEL would like to know which person from the subcontractor is going to which particular Fab and who is working on which day.  If there is an emergency TEL needs to know which subcontractor is at the different Fab locations so they can perform the quick safety action required.
>Preconditions (What is needed before this can happen)
>Post Conditions (What happens after the event happens/what is everything affected by change)
>Giving the sub-contractor will work OOB.
Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria: 1. Contractor supervisor will be able to schedule a subcontractor to a task.
>2. E-mail should be sent out by assigning team on the project "Team Assignment Information" section **Adam Comment: This is covered in #236
>3. Subcontractor will only see their own resource on schedule board / schedule assistant by filtering resource by team as default **Adam comment: This is covered in 235.

System.Title: Ability to support escalation for Startup
Custom.ReqReason: Code Complete and System Test Passed
System.Description: >Hitachi has built escalation on Work Order and on Case entity.
>Tool is down and cannot be fixed in 24 hours.
> is to allow an escalation item to be created and tracked from PSA for Startup.  PSA would tie into Hitachi's current escalation solution.

>User could generate an escalation for additional support, or a technical issue if they need\nhelp. An example of this would be if customer will not give technical acceptance.  The technical acceptance completed date might be March 30, but as of March 25 we were still having issues and an escalation would need to be raised.
>Documentation on escalation can be found in Teams:
>1. TEL Phase 2 -> Files -> General -> TELHQ Discussion Material -> TEL Current Operation Material -> Escalation
>Trigger Events (What event makes this happen)
>Preconditions (What is needed before this can happen)
>Post Conditions (What happens after the event happens/what is everything affected by change)
System.History: As Requirement has been completed , marking it resolved
Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria: <div>1. User should be able to create a support escalation request from PSA <span style=\
>labor overage, miss machine hand-off date and/or technical acceptance date

>
2. User will be taken to existing escalation form and process when generating a new escalation, editing an existing escalation request, or viewing an escalation request.

3. Able to verify the intended recipient of the email that the escalation notification was received.

>4.Automatically raise escalation for technical acceptance delay when "Today" exceed "planed end time" of Technical Acceptance mile stone selected project task. (*If this requirement is difficult to fit to MVP please let us know, if it takes alot of effort we can move to Phase 3)
Microsoft.Services.Custom.ArchComments: Leverage the same escalation feature developed by Hitachi. Since escalation is associated with the work order, so the existing process flow for escalation would hold true. PSA app to enable escalation entity on the sitemap for easy access.
System.Tags: FSM; HISOL#12336; HISOL#12337; HISOL#12338; HISOL#12675; Hitachi; Solution-Modeling-W2; Sprint -2

System.Title: Technical Acceptance Report
System.Description:
>Background

Customer signs technical acceptance report once they agree that the tool installed meets all of the requirements requested.  Once this is signed then TEL can recognize the revenue.  The warranty of the tool will also start on the day it is signed.  This report is currently in paper form.

>TEL would like the option for digital form that customer can use a digital signature on it (DocuSign).

Requirement
Develop the Technical Acceptance Report and allow the customer to use a digital signature on it (DocuSign).



TEL has provided sample of report.

First step is to create the electronic report and DocuSign.  Step 4 is integration with SAP.


***The DocuSign fields in the report should be added automatically with code.
Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. Customer can digitally sign Technical Acceptance Report.

2. Signed copy of Technical Acceptance Report will be saved to the system.
>3. Generate Technical acceptance report from Project entity and automatically attach populated file to the Attachment on project.
>(Word template is ok to be used if above requirement can not be met with SSRS)

>4. Replicate WO E-sign function on Project entity to set customer signer, notification to  customer and assistant, request / cancel / re-submit, use template on docusign, set customer signed date back to project etc.
> (Please see attached file for detail)
>5.In Phase 3 need to build xECM integration function to be able to integrate the signed file to xECM from Project entity (Same function build on WO for SAP Integration)

System.Title: Remaining Task for Genpo Engineers
Custom.ReqReason: Code Complete and System Test Passed
System.Description:
>

Remaining tasks to be completed by the Genpo Engineer after the Factory Engineer goes back to Japan. These tasks are part of the hardware set-up.  These tasks should also be flagged to identify they are remaining Genpo tasks and show the status. 

Need to capture who completed\nthese remaining tasks and when.  These unfinished tasks should be displayed on the \u201cOn-Site Work Remaining\u201d tab (covered in
>) to check the progress and status by the Genpo engineer and easily view which ones need to be completed.

>Please see flow in the file attachments.  The new fields for the MVP requirements will be stored in one spreadsheet on Teams.  Please review  at TEL Phase 2 -> General -> Files -> Requirements ->"Entity Fields Vxx"
>Want to add the Task Status field to the new On-site Work Remaining tab, once we receive the source code from the product team.
>Status for the Project Task is part of the new design requirement for <a href=\

>
Remaining Tasks for Genpo Engineers will have a \u201cGenpo transfer task\u201d as a Boolean field to flag it on the Project Task.

>Discussions for future phase
Look at a solution where it could be flagged in the work order service tasks that it is getting transferred to an engineer. This could generate a new booking for the Genpo Engineer to complete it, all from the mobile app.

Field Security
No field security needed on the Boolean value.
>Trigger Events (What event makes this happen)
>Preconditions (What is\nneeded before this can happen)
>Post Conditions (What\nhappens after the event happens/what is everything affected by change)
Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria: >1. Factory engineer can flag task to be completed by the Genpo engineer. Flag field: <span style=\
>2.  User must be able to view Factory Remaining Tasks separately than other tasks.
>3.  User must have ability to assign Genpo engineer to complete these tasks.

System.Title: Daily Hours Sync back to PSA
Custom.ReqReason: Code Complete and System Test Passed
System.Description: >Multiple bookings worked at a time #240
>Latest discussions with TEL, the preference is expected
>Used by: TEL employees & dispatch (Including Genpo\nengineer)

>Would like to have the task level actual hours worked reflected from work order back to the PSA project task.  Would also like to track any travel that happens. These are needed to see historically how much these projects cost and take to complete.  TEL will use this data to create the project templates for more accurate effort.   

Requirements for Prototype Case:

>
  • Would like to track the actual hours (#168 changing label to “Total Hours”) worked reflected from work order back to the PSA project task. 
  • Status is automatically changed to “In-progress” when man-hours are modified to PSA tasks.
  • Progress percent will be systematically updated from the estimated hour and the actual hours.
  • Once actual hours are assigned to the project status task, TEL wants the status to change to in progress on the project task.

>
  • If the planned hours were 10 and have 12 actual\nhours but the task is not completed yet, then TEL would manually change the\nprogress percent to a lower number.
>Eric comment:  might also want to create a custom field to track these progress percent complete, since these hours can run over 100% progress a lot, but still not be actually completed.
>Used by: TEL employees & dispatch (Including Genpo engineer)

>Do not have to have the granular data from the Mass\nproduction machine for start-up.  TEL factory does not believe the Prototype case is user friendly and time consuming.  Due to this suggesting to only have 1 WO Service Task to 1 Booking per resource for a Work Order.
>f we can do this route, we would not have to have
> cases and could do the same way (see flow attachment).
>Requirements for Start-up Mass Production Machine:

>
  • Engineer obtains the task start time by changing\nthe status of each work.
  • Link the start time of the service task with the\nPSA project task and update the task status.
  • W ill track information and hours at the WO Service Task level only.  This will need to create the Time Entries or the engineer will need to create them manually.

>
  • Eric recommendation for TEL to invest in some customization for this item.  Could add mobile offline to allow end users to swipe for all time on the booking to distribute it to the service tasks.   This investment would also work with Project operations.  Could even be just an input box. More discussion to have on this.
  • The service task status is currently “complete” or “not complete”. TEL would also like to add the values “started“ for these Mass production items.  If the service task is set to started then the project task status will be set to In-progress.
  • Progress complete of the project task will be manually updated by the start-up leader and will not be automated since actual hours are not tracked.

>TEL cannot manage subcontractor’s working hours but can assign a named to the resource.  Cannot add how many hours the subcontractor has completed for each day and cannot tell the subcontractor the hours to work for a day.  TEL can only ask the subcontractor for a percentage complete.  This is especially true for Japan and Korea.  In this case would only track if completed or not and the progress.

>
  • Time entry would not be used with this model.  TEL is having their start-up leader manually adds the subcontractor’s daily hours into the Plan and Passdown module, but not into work order. 
  • Subcontractor would manually update the service task for completion and progress, and it would systematically update the project task progress and status. Just won’t know how many hours.

>Eric comment:  Not tracking the subcontractor’s actual hours could make the project look like it is running well, but that might not be the case.  This is because a project might have 10 hours associated to it and will be completed with zero actual hours.
>Preconditions (What is\nneeded before this can happen)
Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. Resource should only have 1 booking per work order.
2. Ability to track work and status on a project sub task level.  Fields include: task status, start date, end date, non-conformance hours, and total hours.
3. Ability to track hours worked after the work has already been completed (ex. hotel).
4.
>System should automatically set the status of a work order to complete, when a project sub tasks status is set to complete??? need clarification from MCS.
>    <b>TEL's request: When service task is completed on WO side, we would like to change project sub-task status to be completed. <a href=\

>@Adam Sexton 
5. Ability to set progress manually for certain scenarios.
6. Ability for subcontractors to update actual start date, task status, and progress without having to enter in hours worked.
Microsoft.Services.Custom.ArchComments: Please refer to the attachment for the solution approach
